text:
Today was an incredibly important step in the fight against homelessness in Los Angeles.

Thank you @SecFudge for coming to our city to continue talks with folks on the ground and to examine ways to leverage HUD resources to produce quality housing in our communities. https://t.co/QstCcUrbab

One group that’s incredibly prone to falling into homelessness is people who were formerly incarcerated. 

Today, @SecFudge and I are meeting with service providers to find ways to make changes that will ultimately get people in housing faster. https://t.co/nVGbANHoEq

We have to be solution-oriented when it comes to this crisis. 

The Hilda L. Solis Care First Village serves as a steppingstone for unsheltered Angelenos through housing, wellness, employment. 

Thank you @HildaSolis for joining me and @SecFudge today. https://t.co/4BL8uD0pQ6

More than 60,000 people are experiencing homelessness across Los Angeles County. 

I invited @SecFudge here to get a first-hand look at the homelessness crisis and to see what more we can do on the federal level to get people housed. https://t.co/dBjaQmcunN

A grocery store. 

A church. 

An elementary school.

Now a hospital. 

All in the span of 3 weeks. How many people will die before the gun lobby and Republicans get out of our way and stop blocking our bills?
https://t.co/AJRgploRYV

Students all across the country should not go to school wondering whether or not they’ll be safe. 

We have to do more to keep our young people safe. https://t.co/GzWkehnrey

Thank you @SecFudge for agreeing to come to Los Angeles tomorrow to see first-hand the extent of the homelessness crisis here and the urgent need for additional housing assistance. 

I look forward to meeting with you.
